title: Enhancing Transparent Object Pose Estimation: A Fusion of GDR-Net and Edge Detection
author: Tessa Pulli (Automation and Control Institute TU Wien), Stefan Thalhammer (Department of Industrial Engineering University of Applied Sciences Technikum Wien), Peter Hönig (Automation and Control Institute TU Wien), Matthias Hirschmanner (Automation and Control Institute TU Wien), Markus Vincze (Automation and Control Institute TU Wien), ...
relevance_why: The usage of edge detection in pose estimation, particularly for transparent objects, could inspire novel approaches in audio-visual integration and enhance audio generation tasks within spatial contexts.
background: Estimating the 6D pose of transparent objects in a 3D space using only RGB images, which is challenging due to lighting and reflective properties.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel method that applies edge detection as a pre-processing step to enhance the GDR-Net framework for estimating the pose of transparent objects, achieving improved estimation accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous approaches struggle with depth data and textures of transparent objects, often relying on RGB-D methods that perform poorly.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work incorporates edge detection techniques to highlight object boundaries, which aids in robust pose estimation using only RGB inputs.

key_innovation: The method uniquely integrates edge detection as a pre-processing step to enhance geometric features, particularly for transparent objects.
real_world_impact: Successfully improving pose estimation for transparent objects may lead to advancements in robotic grasping and manipulation tasks in real-world applications, enhancing automation and precision.
limitations: The method was tested exclusively with synthetic data, and the performance on real-world scenarios remains unvalidated.

new_terms.6D pose estimation: **6D pose estimation** refers to the process of determining both the position and orientation of an object in a three-dimensional space, encompassing six degrees of freedom.
new_terms.edge detection: **Edge detection** is a technique used in image processing to identify the boundaries of objects within images, often enhancing the task of feature extraction.
